More Notes: Percent difference in property value. Volatility & decline, oceanfront worse.
Change in beach width. Immediate decline without subsidy.
Change in income tax rate. Increase in tax rates.
Change in investor market share. Investors own less.
Property values plummet sharply when outside markets decline despite continued nourishment. Value is set to zero since the exact decline is not quantified.
Risk premium increases when outside markets decline despite continued nourishment. Value is set to zero since the exact increase is not quantified.

Benefit is the increase in property value compared to the case of no nourishment. Each agent evaluates whether the property value increase is greater than the extra tax burden. If yes, then the agent votes to nourish. Proposed nourishment plan is implemented if at least 50% of resident-owner agents vote to nourish.

Costs are quantified as the temporary (five-year) increase in property taxes (Ï„P) needed to fund the municipal bonds that pay for the nourishment plan. Agents vote on nourishment plans based on comparison of property tax burden and property value increase.
